title: Presidential Nominations sent to the Senate, 05-21-09 | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House




May 21, 2009

 



Presidential Nominations sent to the Senate, 05-21-09




 THE WHITE HOUSE Office of the Press Secretary _____________________________________________ FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE         May 21, 2009 NOMINATIONS SENT TO THE SENATE: Paul T. Anastas, of Connecticut, to be an Assistant Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, vice George M. Gray, resigned. Cranston J. Mitchell, of Virginia, to be a Commissioner of the United States Parole Commission for a term of six years. (Reappointment) Nancy J. Powell, of Iowa, a Career Member of the Senior Foreign Service, Class of Career Minister, to be Director General of the Foreign Service, vice Harry K. Thomas, Jr., resigned.
